hanzi-su-wiki:
鐘

Значения

Колокол; часы

Мнемоника

Дополнительная обязанность сироты — пастушка 童 — отзванивать время металлическим 金 колоколом.

Варианты

钟

heisig_chinese_memo: The metal bell rings to call the juveniles to class.
heisig_constituent: bell, metal, gold, juvenile, vase, stand up, computer
heisig_story: This bell is made of cheap metal, and so badly made that when you ring it, it lets out a noise like the "bellowing" of juveniles who aren't getting their own way.
koohiiStory1: The METAL bell rings to call the JUVENILES to class.
koohiiStory2: The METAL bell rings to call the JUVENILES to COMPUTER class.
jp_example_words:
釣鐘(つりがね): hanging bell
鐘(かね): bell, chime
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Something made of gold stands in a village. It's a bell! The village bell.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Every village has a bell of its own, standing tall and proud and shiny in the middle for everyone to see and hear.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The bell rings whenever the Shougun (しょう) arrives in the village. Its ringing echoes throughout the entire village so everyone knows they have to come out and pay their respects.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The Shougun bell even sounds like it's warning you that the Shougun has arrived. It makes a loud, low shooooouu shooou sound.
Ru_trainchinese: zhōng: (сущ) часы; колокол; время (для указания часов и минут)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the child's (童) gold (金) is a bell
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The middle of a bell is a metal piece which hits the sides of the bell to make a sound.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from " gold " to " child " sound. The " bell " is a percussive instrument, often played at temples and ceremonies and banquets. "Said Wen": "Zhong, Le Zhong also." Or the style is "銿". " Yong " was originally the pictogram of a bell, and the addition of " gold " next to it means it was cast in bronze. (Yang Shuda) " Yong " and " Tong " are similar in ancient sounds, so "銿" can also be used as " bell ". See " Yong ".

Bronze inscriptions means music bells, such as Zhongyi Bell: "Zhongyizha (made) and bells are forever treasure." Zang Sunzhong: "From Zha (made) and bells, descendants and grandchildren Sun Yongbao follow. For example, Zeng Hou Yizhong: "Cut (aunt) [Xianyu] (wash) Chu is called Lu Zhong, and its Ban (reverse) is Xuan Zhong." "Lu Zhong" and "Xuan Zhong" are both Chu music rules. name.

The materials on bamboo and silk also represent music clocks, such as "Shangbo Zhushu I." Confucius Poems" Jian 14 "The Music of Bells and Drums". Another example is "Shanghai Bo Zhushu Four. "Cao Mo Zhi Chen" Jane 1: "Lu [口戕] (Zhuang) Gong 𨟻 (General) is a big bell." It means that Lu Zhuang is going to cast a big bell.

" Bell " and " bell " can originally mean both bells and drums and wine vessels. The ancient sounds of " child " and " heavy " are also similar. Such as "Liezi. "Yang Zhu": "The court room also gathered a thousand bells of wine, and accumulated koji into a seal." Later, " bell " was used to express music bells, and " bell " meant wine vessels. (Qiu Xigui) See " bell ".

" Bell " also refers to the big bell hung in the temple county, used for time reporting, assembly and alarm. Such as "Luoyang Kalan Records. "Preface": "In the capital, there are more than a thousand temples. Today's squatters, the bells are rarely heard." Zhang Ji of the Tang Dynasty "Fengqiao Night Moor": "The Hanshan Temple outside Gusu City, the bell arrives at the passenger ship in the middle of the night."

" Clock " later also denoted a chime and clock. Ruming Metabolism Zhaozhe "Five Miscellaneous Cu. Tianbu II: "Western monk Matteo Ricci has a self-ringed bell, and there is a central organ. It will ring every hour." Zhao Yi of the Qing Dynasty, "Eaves Exposure Miscellaneous Clocks and Watches": "The self-ringing bells and timepieces come from the West. The clock can be on time. For self-ming, the watch has a needle engraved with the sundial to indicate twelve o'clock, which is all unique skills." It also refers to time, as in Lu Xun's "Scream. "Dragon Boat Festival": "Who knew there was an exception on the fourth day of the Lunar New Year. He came home less than seven o'clock."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " gold " to " children " sound. The " bell " is a percussive instrument, often played at temples and ceremonies and banquets.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「金」，「童」聲。「鐘」是一種敲擊樂器，常常在宮廟祭祀和宴會時演奏。《說文》：「鐘，樂鐘也。」或體作「銿」。「甬」本為鐘的象形，後增「金」旁表示以青銅鑄造。（楊樹達）「甬」和「童」古音相近，故「銿」又可作「鐘」。參見「甬」。

　　金文表示樂鐘，如中義鐘：「中義乍（作）龢鐘，其萬年永寶。 」臧孫鐘：「自乍（作）龢鐘，子子孫孫永保是從。」又表示樂律，如曾侯乙鐘：「割（姑）[先聿]（洗）之才（在）楚號為呂鐘，其坂（反）為宣鐘。」「呂鐘」、「宣鐘」皆為楚樂律名。

　　簡帛材料也表示樂鐘，如《上博竹書一．孔子詩論》簡14「㠯（以）鐘鼓之樂」。又如《上博竹書四．曹沫之陳》簡1：「魯[口戕]（莊）公𨟻（將）為大鐘。」意謂魯莊公將要鑄造大鐘。

　　「鐘」和「鍾」本來既可表示鐘鼓，又可表示酒器。「童」和「重」古音亦相近。如《列子．楊朱》：「朝之室也聚酒千鐘，積麴成封。」後來「鐘」專門用來表示樂鐘，「鍾」則表示酒器。（裘錫圭）參見「鍾」。

　　「鐘」也表示寺廟縣掛的大鐘，用作報時、集合和報警之用。如《洛陽伽藍記．序》：「京城表裏，凡有一千餘寺，今日寮廓，鐘聲罕聞。」唐代張繼〈楓橋夜泊〉：「姑蘇城外寒山寺，夜半鐘聲到客船。」

　　「鐘」後來還表示報時器、時鐘。如明代謝肇淛《五雜俎．天部二》：「西僧利瑪竇有自鳴鐘，中設機關，每遇一時輒鳴。」清代趙翼《簷曝雜記鐘表》：「自鳴鐘、時辰表，皆來自西洋。鐘能按時自鳴，表則有針隨晷刻指十二時，皆絕技也。」又指時間，如魯迅《吶喊．端午節》：「誰知道初四這一天卻破了例，他不到七點鐘便回家來。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「金」，「童」聲。「鐘」是一種敲擊樂器，常常在宮廟祭祀和宴會時演奏。

(Simplified: 钟)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 童 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 童 [ tóng ] child, boy; servant boy; virgin
①金屬製成的響器，中空，敲時發聲：警鐘。編鐘(古代樂器。把一系列銅製的鐘掛在木架上組成，用小木槌擊奏。各時代形制大小不一，枚數也不同)。鐘鼎(古銅器總稱，上面銘刻文字)。
②計時的器具：鐘錶(鍾和表的總稱)。座鐘。鐘鳴漏盡(晨鐘已鳴，夜漏將盡。喻年屆遲幕)。
③指某個一定的時間，小時：鐘頭(小時，如“開了一個鐘鐘的會”)。
④杯子。
⑤集中，專一：鍾情(感情專注)。鍾愛(特別愛)。鍾靈毓秀(指美好的自然環境產生優秀的人物)。
⑥古代器名，一種圓形銅壺。
⑦中國古代計量單位，春秋時齊國以十釜爲“鍾”(標準不一)。
⑧姓氏。

鐘錶 [ zhōng biǎo ]: clock
鍾愛 [ zhōng ài ]: to treasure; to be very fond of

釣鐘(つりがね): hanging bell
鐘(かね): bell, chime

金文從「 金 」，「 童 」聲。「 鐘 」是一種敲擊樂器，常常在宮廟祭祀和宴會時演奏。《說文》：「鐘，樂鐘也。」或體作「 銿 」。「 甬 」本為鐘的象形，後增「 金 」旁表示以青銅鑄造。（楊樹達）「 甬 」和「 童 」古音相近，故「 銿 」又可作「 鐘 」。參見「 甬 」。 金文表示樂鐘，如中義鐘：「中義乍（作）龢鐘，其萬年永寶。 」臧孫鐘：「自乍（作）龢鐘，子子孫孫永保是從。」又表示樂律，如曾侯乙鐘：「割（姑）[先聿]（洗）之才（在）楚號為呂鐘，其坂（反）為宣鐘。」「呂鐘」、「宣鐘」皆為楚樂律名。 簡帛材料也表示樂鐘，如《上博竹書一．孔子詩論》簡14「㠯（以）鐘鼓之樂」。又如《上博竹書四．曹沫之陳》簡1：「魯[口戕]（莊）公𨟻（將）為大鐘。」意謂魯莊公將要鑄造大鐘。 「 鐘 」和「 鍾 」本來既可表示鐘鼓，又可表示酒器。「 童 」和「 重 」古音亦相近。如《列子．楊朱》：「朝之室也聚酒千鐘，積麴成封。」後來「 鐘 」專門用來表示樂鐘，「 鍾 」則表示酒器。（裘錫圭）參見「 鍾 」。 「 鐘 」也表示寺廟縣掛的大鐘，用作報時、集合和報警之用。如《洛陽伽藍記．序》：「京城表裏，凡有一千餘寺，今日寮廓，鐘聲罕聞。」唐代張繼〈楓橋夜泊〉：「姑蘇城外寒山寺，夜半鐘聲到客船。」 「 鐘 」後來還表示報時器、時鐘。如明代謝肇淛《五雜俎．天部二》：「西僧利瑪竇有自鳴鐘，中設機關，每遇一時輒鳴。」清代趙翼《簷曝雜記鐘表》：「自鳴鐘、時辰表，皆來自西洋。鐘能按時自鳴，表則有針隨晷刻指十二時，皆絕技也。」又指時間，如魯迅《吶喊．端午節》：「誰知道初四這一天卻破了例，他不到七點鐘便回家來。」

鐘字的基本解释

鐘
zhōng
见“钟”①鐘③。

鐘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhōng］
［《廣韻》職容切，平鍾，章。］
“钟2”的繁体字。“鈡1”的繁体字。亦作“銿1”。
(1)古代乐器。青铜制，悬挂于架上，以槌叩击发音。祭祀或宴享时用。战斗中亦用以指挥进退。西周中期开始有十几个大小成组的称编钟，大而单一的称特钟。
(2)梵语Ghant的意译。佛寺悬挂的钟。多用作报时、报警、集合的信号。
(3)泛指击以报时的钟。
(4)指鸣钟。
(5)计时的器具。比表大，有挂在墙上的，也有放在桌上的。
(6)指钟点，时间。
(7)古容量单位。

鐘字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鐘； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1323第02
【唐韻】職容切【集韻】【韻會】諸容切，?音鍾。【說文】樂鐘也。【廣韻】世本曰：垂作鐘。【釋名】鐘，空也。內空受氣多，故聲大也。【詩·周南】鐘鼓樂之。　又【韻會】律名，黃鐘十一月，夾鐘二月，林鐘六月，應鐘十月。◎按《周》《禮》皆作鍾，古字通用。互詳前鍾字註。　又地名。【春秋·桓十一年】公會宋公于夫鐘。【註】夫鐘，郕地。　又山名。【廣輿記】鐘山屬金陵。　【集韻】或作銿。

鐘字的源字形

字源演变：

金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鐘字的起名意思

暂无。

zhōng

bell
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhōng］
["Guangyun" job title cut, Ping Zhong, chapter. ]
Traditional characters for "钟2". "鈡1" in traditional characters. Also known as "銿1".
(1) Ancient musical instruments. Made of bronze, hung on a rack, and pronounced with a hammer tap. It is used for sacrificial offerings or feasts. It is also used to command advance and retreat in battle. From the middle of the Western Zhou Dynasty, there were more than a dozen large and small groups called chimes, and the large and single ones were called special bells.
(2) The free translation of Sanskrit Ghant. The bell hanging in the Buddhist temple. It is mostly used as a signal for time telling, alarm, and assembly.
(3) Generally refers to a bell that strikes to tell the time.
(4) Refers to the bell ringing.
(5) Timekeeping equipment. Larger than a watch, some are hung on the wall, and some are placed on the table.
(6) Refers to the hour, time.
(7) Ancient capacity unit.
bell
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Department] 　 Bell; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: Page 1323 No. 02
[Tang Yun] Job Rongqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] Zhu Rongqie,? Tone bell. [Said Wen] Le Zhong also. [Guangyun] Shiben said: hanging clock. [Release name] Bell, empty. The inner space receives a lot of air, so the sound is loud. 【Poetry·Zhou Nan】The music of bells and drums.　[Rhyme Club] The name of the law, Huang Zhong in November, Jia Zhong in February, Lin Zhong in June, Ying Zhong in October. ◎According to "Zhou" and "Li", they all make clocks, and the ancient characters are common. Mutual details before the clock note.　Also place name. [Spring and Autumn · 11th Year of Huan] Song Gong Yu Fuzhong of the guild. [Note] Husband Zhong, Yi Di.　Also the name of the mountain. [Guang Yu Ji] Zhongshan belongs to Jinling.　【Ji Yun】or Zuo 銿.

Name meaning

zhōng
вм. 钟
Radicals: 金, 立, 里  (gold, stand, village)
Meaning Mnemonic
Something made of gold stands in a village. It's a bell! The village bell.
Every village has a bell of its own, standing tall and proud and shiny in the middle for everyone to see and hear.
Reading Mnemonic
The bell rings whenever the Shougun (しょう) arrives in the village. Its ringing echoes throughout the entire village so everyone knows they have to come out and pay their respects.
The Shougun bell even sounds like it's warning you that the Shougun has arrived. It makes a loud, low shooooouu shooou sound.
